en: In February, Hassans administration lifted bans on four media outlets: Mseto, Mawio, Mwanahalisi and Tanzania Daima.
xho: NgoFebruwari, ulawulo lukaHassan lususe ukuvalwa kwemithombo yeendaba ezine: iMseto, iMawio, iMwanahalisi kunye neTanzania Daima.

en: They  had been shuttered for offenses related to their coverage of alleged corruption, according to Amnesty International.

mt0: <pad> They were held on charges of fraud, according to Amnesty International.</s>

en: And Hassan has instructed the Ministry of Information, Communication and Information Technology to work with media stakeholders and others on reviewing laws and possibly loosening restrictions.

mt0: <pad> And Hassan has ordered the Minister of Information, Communications and ICT to work with media agencies and others to review the laws and possibly remove restrictions.</s>

en: Melo is among those being asked to weigh in on what he calls "draconian" measures such as the 2015 Cybercrimes Act and 2016 Media Services Act.
xho: UMelo uphakathi kwabo bacelwe ukuba baphonononge amanyathelo awabiza ngokuba “yidraconian” afana nomthetho i-Cybercrimes Act ka-2015 kunye noMthetho weeNkonzo zeMedia ka-2016.
mt0: <pad> Melo is among those asked to review measures he called "idraconian" such as the Cybercrimes Act of 2015 and the Media Services Act of 2016.</s>

en: Ive been part of the team that has been reviewing the laws, said Melo, who had previously felt their bite.
xho: “Ndibe yinxalenye yeqela ebeliphonononga imithetho,” utshilo uMelo owayekhe wakuva ngaphambili ukulunywa yilemithetho.
mt0: <pad> "I was part of the team that went against the rules," Melo said, who had previously experienced being abused by those rules.</s>

en: He was convicted in April 2020 of obstructing police investigations, and paid a fine of 3 million Tanzanian shillings, or $1,300, rather than face a year behind bars, according to the Committee to Protect Journalists.
xho: Wafunyaniswa enetyala ngo-Epreli ka-2020 ngokuthintela uphando lwamapolisa, kwaye wahlawula imali ezizigidi ezi-3 zeerandi zaseTanzania, okanye i-1,300 yeedola, kunokuba ajongane nonyaka entolongweni, ngokutsho kweKomiti yokukhusela iintatheli.
mt0: <pad> He was convicted in April 2020 for obstructing police investigation, and paid a fine of 3 million Tanzanian shillings, or 1,300 US dollars, rather than face a year in jail, according to the Committee to Protect Journalists.</s>

en: CPJ, which honored Melo with its 2019 International Press Freedom Award, noted that the "charge stemmed from Melos alleged refusal to disclose the identities of whistleblowers on the Jamii Forums platform.

mt0: <pad> The CPJ, which honoured Melo with the International Press Freedom Award in 2019, said that the charges were "triggered by Melo's refusal to disclose the identities of the callers on the Jamii Forums platform."</s>

en: Melo told VOA that Jamii Forums, founded as a for-profit business, now is a nongovernmental organization.

mt0: <pad> Melo told VOA that Jamii Forums, which was founded as a profit-making business, is now an non-governmental organization.</s>

en: We are focusing on good governance, accountability and democracy, he said.

mt0: <pad> "We are focused on good governance, accountability and democracy," he said.</s>

en: Since Hassan took office, Melo said, "people on the cyberspace can now at least criticize the government or critically analyze whatever kind of statement that comes from any political figure.

mt0: <pad> Since Hassan's appointment, Melo said, "people in cyberspace now can criticize the government or critically assess any kind of report from any politician."</s>

en: At the moment, journalists are now writing stories that could not be written in the past six years."

en: When it comes to news media, "indeed, the environment is slowly opening up," agreed Roland Ebole, an Amnesty International researcher.

en: You cannot have a profession without rules to govern, like a tire moving without any control, spokesman Greyson Msigwa said in a recent interview.

mt0: <pad> "You can't have a job without rules, like a car that goes without being controlled," said Greyson Msigwa in a recent interview.</s>

en: Extremist Rebels Launch Deadly Attack in Northeast Nigeria
xho: Abavukeli abaneembono ezibaxiweyo baqalisa uhlaselo olubulalayo kuMntla-mpuma weNigeria.

en: Islamic extremist rebels have killed at least seven people in an attack in northeast Borno state in Nigeria, witnesses told The Associated Press on Wednesday.
xho: Abavukeli abangamaSilamsi abaneengcwangu babulale abantu abasixhenxe ubuncinci kuhlaselo olukumantla mpuma weBorno eNigeria, amangqina axelele I-Associated Press ngoLwesithathu.
mt0: <pad> Islamic militants have killed at least seven people in an attack northeast of Borno state in Nigeria, witnesses told the AP on Wednesday.</s>

xho: Abavukeli bahlasele ilali yaseKautukari kwingingqi yaseChibok eBorno ngorhatya lwangoLwesibini, batsho abahlali.

en: The attack happened at the same time that U.N. Secretary-General Antonio Guterres was in the state to meet with survivors of jihadi violence.
xho: Olu hlaselo lwenzeka ngaxesha linye apho unobhala-jikelele we-UN u-Antonio Guterres wayekurhulumente ezokudibana nabasinde kubundlobongela be-jihadi.
mt0: <pad> The attack occurred at the same time that UN Secretary General Antonio Guterres was in government to meet with victims of jihadi terror.</s>

en: The Chibok area is 115 kilometers (71 miles) away from Maiduguri, the state capital, where Guterres met with former militants being reintegrated into society and thousands of people displaced by the insurgency.
xho: Indawo yaseChibok ikwiikhilomitha ezili-115 (iimiles ezingama -71) ukusuka eMaiduguri, ikomkhulu likarhulumente, apho uGuterres wadibana khona nababesakuba ngabavukeli baphinda badityaniswa kuluntu kunye namawakawaka abantu abagxothwayo ngenxa yovukelo.
mt0: <pad> The Chibok site is 115 kilometers (71 miles) from Maiduguri, the capital of the government, where Guterres met with former rebels reunited with the community and thousands of people displaced as a result of the rebellion.</s>

en: They came in large number with superior firepower (and) took over the community, said Hassan Chibok, a community leader.
xho: “Beze ngobuninzi babo benamandla omlilo aphezulu (kwaye) baluthatha uluntu,” utshilo uHassan Chibok, inkokeli yabahlali.
mt0: <pad> "They came in their great number with high firepower and they captured the people," said Hassan Chibok, a leader of the villagers.</s>

mt0: <pad> troops from a nearby military station were said to have defeated the attack but "damage has been done," Chibok said, adding that "the victims are up to 10."</s>

en: Nigeria, Africa's most populous country with 206 million people, continues to grapple with a 10-year-old insurgency in the northeast by Islamic extremist rebels of Boko Haram and its offshoot, the Islamic State West Africa Province.

mt0: <pad> Nigeria, the most populous African country with 206 million people, continues to fight a 10-year Islamist rebellion in the north-east by Boko Haram and its branch, the Islamic State West Africa Province.</s>

en: The extremists are fighting to establish Shariah law and to stop Western education.

xho: ISouth Sudan inomsebenzi omninzi ekufuneka wenziwe ukuseka kunye nokuqinisa amaziko abalulekileyo kurhulumente wedemokhrasi osebenza kakuhle, utshilo uDavid Renz.
