en: Economists Predict Bumpy Road for Malawi's Economy in 2015.
xho: Iingcali zezoQoqosho zibona amagingxingxi kwindlela eya phambili kuQoqosho lwaseMalawi ngo-2015.
mt0: <pad> Economic experts see a lack of progress in the Malawian economy in 2015.</s>

en: Economists in Malawi say the country is likely to continue facing financial challenges in 2015 unless the government can regain the confidence of donors, who are still withholding 40 percent of budgetary support due to the corruption scandal known as Cashgate.
xho: Iingcali zoqoqosho eMalawi zithi eli lizwe kusenokwenzeka ukuba liqhubeleke lijongene nemingeni yemali ngo-2015 ngaphandle kokuba urhulumente angaphinda athembeke kubaxhasi, abasabambe umyinge wamashumi amane eepesenti ekhulwini wenkxaso yohlahlo lwabiwo-mali ngenxa yorhwaphilizo olwaziwa njengeCashgate.
mt0: <pad> Economic experts in Malawi say the country is likely to continue to face financial difficulties in 2015 unless the government can regain trust from its backers, who have held 40 percent of the budget support due to the Cashgate scandal.</s>

en: More than $30 million were looted from government coffers in the scandal, and several people, including government officials, were arrested.
xho: Imali engaphezu kwezigidi ezingama-30 zeerandi yaphangwa kwingxowa-mali karhulumente kulo manyala, yaye abantu abaliqela, kuquka namagosa karhulumente, babanjwa.
mt0: <pad> Over 30 million ariads were stolen from the government's treasury in this scam, and several people, including government officials, were arrested.</s>

en: The withholding of donor aid has forced Malawi's government to pass what is known as the Zero Aid national budget for the
xho: Ukubanjwa koncedo lwabaxhasi kuye kwanyanzela urhulumente waseMalawi ukuba aphumeze oko kwaziwa ngokuba yiZero Aid budget yesizwe.
mt0: <pad> The suspension of aid has forced the government of Malawi to issue what is now known as the Zero Aid budget for the national.</s>

en: 2014-2015 fiscal year. Analysts, such as Abel Mwanyungwe, an economics lecturer at the Polytechnic College of the University
xho: Unyaka-mali ka-2014-2015. Abahlalutyi, abafana noAbel Mwanyungwe, umhlohli wezoqoqosho kwiKholeji yasePolytechnic yeYunivesithi.
mt0: <pad> 2014-2015. Analysts, such as Abel Mwanyungwe, an economics professor at the Polytechnic College of the University of the Republic of the Congo, say that the economy is going to be weaker than it was in 2014-2015.</s>

en: of Malawi, say the drop in spending has hurt the economy.
xho: waseMalawi, bathi ukuhla kwenkcitho konakalisa uqoqosho.
mt0: <pad> Malawi, they say that the fall in expenditure has affected the economy.</s>

en: This has been a bumpy year as we are coming from the Cashgate effects that have quite a major dent on the economys performance.
xho: “Lo ibingunyaka wamagingxigingxi njengoko siphuma kwiziphumo zeCashgate ezithe kratya kuqoqosho lweli.
mt0: <pad> "This has been a turbulent year as we emerged from the effects of the Cashgate scandal that have had a short-term impact on the country's economy."</s>

en: We have seen that in most cases the very delicate and crucial departments and service providers have been affected, in the sense that we dont have enough drugs in the hospitals.
xho: Sibonile ukuba kwiimeko ezininzi amasebe abuthathaka nabalulekileyo kunye nabanikezeli beenkonzo baye bachaphazeleka, ngendlela yokuba asinawo amayeza aneleyo ezibhedlele.
mt0: <pad> We have seen that in many cases the weakest and most important sectors and service providers have been affected, so that we don't have enough medicine in hospitals.</s>

en: In schools, in terms of teachers payments is not in time," said Mwanyungwe.
xho: Ezikolweni, intlawulo yootitshala ayifiki ngexesha,” utshilo uMwanyungwe.
mt0: <pad> In schools, the payment of teachers is not on time," said Mwanyangwe.</s>

en: Mwanyungwe also links Cashgate to the recent depreciation of Malawis currency, the kwacha, which has resulted in strikes by various government workers demanding higher pay.
xho: UMwanyungwe ukwayamanise iCashgate nokuhla kwexabiso lemali yaseMalawi, kwacha, okubangele uqhankqalazo lwabasebenzi abohlukeneyo bakarhulumente befuna ukunyuselwa imivuzo.
mt0: <pad> The Cashgate scandal was also linked to the fall in the value of the Malawian currency, the kwacha, which caused protests by government employees demanding a raise in their pay.</s>

en: For example, support staff for the judiciary have been on strike for six weeks, seeking a 45 percent pay increase which the government says it cannot afford because it has no money.
xho: Umzekelo, abasebenzi abanika inkxaso kwiinkundla bezikwisithuba seeveki ezintandathu begwayimba, befuna ukunyuselwa imivuzo ngeepesenti ezingamashumi amane anesihlanu ekhulwini nto leyo urhulumente athi akanako ukuyifikelela kuba akanamali.
mt0: <pad> For example, court support workers have been on strike for six weeks, demanding an increase in pay by 45 percent, which the government says it can't achieve because it doesn't have the money.</s>

en: Workers at Malawi's Anti-Corruption Bureau went on strike demanding a 70 percent pay raise until the government threatened to forfeit their December salaries if they did not return.
xho: Abasebenzi beAnti-Corruption Bureau eMalawi baye bagwayimba befuna ukunyuselwa imivuzo ngamashumi asixhenxe ekhulwini de urhulumente wabagrogrisa ngelithi baza kuphulukana nemivuzo yabo kaDisemba ukuba ababuyi.
mt0: <pad> The employees of the Anti-Corruption Bureau in Malawi have been on strike demanding a 70% pay rise until the government threatened them with losing their December salary if they did not return.</s>

en: Mwanyungwe said the government can only avoid further strikes in 2015 if it makes efforts to restore donor confidence in the management of its public finances.

mt0: <pad> The government could prevent another protest in 2015 if it made efforts to regain the trust of investors in the government's fiscal management.</s>

en: My fear is that if we dont have this donor confidence and donor support coming back to the economy,
xho: “Uloyiko lwam kukuba, ukuba asinalo ukuzithemba kwabaxhasi kunye nenkxaso yabaxhasi ibuyela kuqoqosho,
mt0: <pad> "My fear is that, if we don't have the confidence and support of investors, the return to the economy will be difficult.</s>

en: We may force the government to go into serious local borrowing that would lead to serious repercussions in terms of inflation, in terms of interest rates and this may have a sort of catch-catch lose situation, said Mwanyungwe.
xho: Singanyazela urhulumente ukuba angene kwimboleko-mali yasekhaya enokuthi ikhokelele kwiziphumo ezibi malunga nokunyuka kwamaxabiso, ngokwenzala yemali-mboleko kwaye oku kunokuba nemeko yokuphulukana nokubanjiswa,” utshilo uMwanyungwe.
mt0: <pad> We can force the government into a home mortgage that will lead to bad effects on price increases, interest rates and this can lead to loss of housing," said Mbuyangwe.</s>

en: The donors are, among other things, demanding that the government prosecute all those involved in the scandal and strengthen its financial management system.
xho: Abaxhasi, phakathi kwezinye izinto, bafuna urhulumente atshutshise bonke abo babandakanyekayo kulo mbhodamo kwaye omeleze inkqubo yolawulo lwemali.
mt0: <pad> Critics, among other things, want the government to punish all those involved in the scandal and strengthen the system of fiscal management.</s>

en: Newton Kambala, the president of the Malawi Confederation of Chambers of Commerce and Industry, said the scandal rendered
xho: UNewton Kambala, umongameli weMalawi Confederation of Chambers of Commerce and Industry, uthe ihlazo elenziwe.
mt0: <pad> Newton Kambala, president of the Malawi Confederation of Chambers of Commerce and Industry, said the insult made was unacceptable.</s>

en: 2014 as "a very bad year for the business sector, because of huge debts that the government owes the private sector."
xho: U-2014 "njengonyaka ombi kakhulu kwicandelo loshishino, ngenxa yamatyala amakhulu urhulumente awatyala icandelo labucala."
mt0: <pad> 2014 "was a very bad year for the business sector, due to the large debts the government imposed on the private sector."</s>

en: He warned that if the situation persists, "2015 will be worse."
xho: Walumkisa ukuba, ukuba imeko iyaqhubeka, "u-2015 uya kuba mbi."
mt0: <pad> He warned that, if the situation continues, "2015 will be bad."</s>

en: In his state of the nation address last Saturday, Malawi president Peter Mutharika said his government is doing everything possible to address the problems caused by the Cashgate scandal.
xho: Kwintetho yakhe yobume besizwe ngoMgqibelo odlulileyo, umongameli waseMalawi uPeter Mutharika uthe urhulumente wakhe wenza konke okusemandleni ukulungisa iingxaki ezibangelwe lihlazo leCashgate.
mt0: <pad> In his state of the nation address on Saturday, Malawian President Peter Mutharika said his government was doing all it can to rectify the problems caused by the scandal of Cashgate.</s>

en: My government has strengthened the financial system to make sure that Cashgate never occurs again in Malawi.
xho: “Urhulumente wam uqinise inkqubo yezemali ukuqinisekisa ukuba iCashgate ayiphindi yenzeke eMalawi.
mt0: <pad> My government has strengthened the financial system to ensure that Cashgate will not happen again in Malawi.</s>

en: We have resourced fairly well the law enforcement institutions, including the Anti-Corruption Bureau, so that they do a thorough independent job, prosecute all suspects, and recover the stolen resources where possible," said Mutharika.
xho: Siwasebenzise kakuhle amaziko ogcino-mthetho aquka iAnti-Corruption Bureau ukuze enze umsebenzi ozimeleyo ngokucokisekileyo, atshutshise bonke abarhanelwa, abuyise nezixhobo ezibiweyo apho kunokwenzeka,” utshilo uMutharika.
mt0: <pad> We have used the law enforcement agencies effectively, including the Anti-Corruption Bureau, to do an independent work with accuracy, arrest all suspects and recover the stolen assets where possible," the Prime Minister said.</s>

en: Mutharika also said his government is implementing newly-adopted fiscal reforms that seek to grow the countrys economy by 5.5 percent in 2014, up from an estimated 5.0 percent in 2013.
xho: UMutharika ukwathe urhulumente wakhe uphumeza inguqu entsha yezemali efuna ukukhulisa uqoqosho lwelizwe nge-5.5 pesenti ngo-2014, isuka kumyinge we-5.0 yeepesenti ngo-2013.
mt0: <pad> The President also announced that his government is launching a new fiscal reform that seeks to grow the country's economy by 5.5 percent in 2014, from a 5.0 percent growth in 2013</s>

en: Malawi to Conduct Door-to-Door HIV Testing
xho: IMalawi izakwenza uVavanyo lwe-HIV kwindlu ngendlu
mt0: <pad> Malawi will conduct HIV tests at every house in the country.</s>

en: Malawians have mixed reactions to government plans to introduce door-to door HIV testing early next year.
xho: Abantu baseMalawi banezimvo ezahlukileyo kwizicwangciso zikarhulumente zokuqalisa ngovavanyo lwe-HIV kwindlu ngendlu ekuqaleni konyaka ozayo.
mt0: <pad> People in Malawi have different views on the government's plans to start HIV tests at home in the beginning of next year.</s>

en: Supporters say the step is urgently needed because 100 Malawians get infected each day, and an average of 138 die from AIDS daily.
xho: Abaxhasi bathi eli nyathelo lifuneka ngokungxamisekileyo kuba abantu baseMalawi abali-100 bayasulelwa suku ngalunye, yaye umlinganiselo we-138 ubulawa nguGawulayo mihla le.
mt0: <pad> Advocates say this measure is urgently needed because 100 people in Malawi are infected with HIV every day, and an average of 138 people die of AIDS every day.</s>

en: Minister of Health Jean Kalirani announced the plans during the recent commemoration of World AIDS Day in the northern district of Karonga.
xho: UMphathiswa wezeMpilo uJean Kalirani ubhengeze ezi zicwangciso ngethuba kutsha nje isikhumbuzo soSuku lweHlabathi lwe-AIDS kwisithili esisemantla eKaronga.
mt0: <pad> The Health Minister Jean Kalirani announced the plans during the recent World Aids Day commemoration in the north of Karonga.</s>

en: We will go in the villages asking for blood samples to check whether that person is HIV positive or not.
xho: “Sizakungena ezilalini sicela ukuba sithathelwe igazi ukuze kujongwe ukuba loo mntu akanayo na okanye akanayo na.
mt0: <pad> "We will go into the villages and ask for blood tests to see if that person has or doesn't have HIV.</s>

en: And those that will be found HIV positive will definitely be given the care they need.
xho: Kwaye abo baya kufunyanwa bene-HIV ngokuqinisekileyo baya kunikwa ukhathalelo abaludingayo.
mt0: <pad> And those who are found to have HIV will be given the care they need.</s>

en: And those who are found negative will also be counseled so that they remain negative," said Kalirani.
xho: Nabo bafunyenwe bengenayo nabo bazolulekwa ukuze bahlale bengenayo,” utshilo uKalirani.
mt0: <pad> They will also be confined to the quarantined area," said Kalarani.</s>

en: Kalirani said the campaign will start in mid-March and will aim to reach everyone in the country, including people who are
xho: UKalirani uthe eli phulo lizakuqala phakathi kuMatshi kwaye liza kujolisa ukufikelela kumntu wonke kweli lizwe kuquka nabantu abakhoyo
mt0: <pad> Kalirani said the campaign will start in mid-March and will target everyone in the country including those who are living abroad.</s>

en: far from health facilities that provide HIV testing and counseling services.
xho: kude nezibonelelo zempilo ezibonelela ngeenkonzo zokuvavanyelwa i-HIV kunye neengcebiso.
mt0: <pad> Distance from health facilities that provide HIV testing and counseling services.</s>

en: She said the campaign is in line with the goal of ending HIV infection by 2030.
xho: Uthe eli phulo lihambelana nenjongo yokuphelisa usulelo lwe-HIV ngo-2030.
mt0: <pad> He said the campaign aligns with the goal to end HIV by 2030.</s>

en: Malawi's HIV infection rate is currently at 10 percent, a slight drop from three years ago.
xho: Umlinganiselo wosulelo lweHIV eMalawi ngoku ukwi-10 ekhulwini, ukwehla kancinci xa kuthelekiswa neminyaka emithathu eyadlulayo.
mt0: <pad> The percentage of HIV infection in Malawi is now 10 percent, a small drop compared to three years ago.</s>

en: The announcement has raised fears in some Malawians, such as Steven Jailosi, a primary school teacher in rural Blantyre, who feel the campaign will likely infringe upon peoples privacy.
xho: Esi sibhengezo sinyuse uloyiko kwabanye abantu baseMalawi, abanjengoSteven Jailosi, utitshala wesikolo samabanga aphantsi eBlantyre, ocinga ukuba eli phulo lingaphazamisa ubumfihlo babantu.
mt0: <pad> The announcement raised fears among some Malawians, such as Steven Jailosi, a teacher at a primary school in Blantyre, who thinks that the campaign could affect people's privacy.</s>

en: I think it is not okay because they will be invading our privacy.
xho: “Ndicinga ukuba akulunganga kuba baza kuphazamisa ubumfihlo bethu.
mt0: <pad> "I think it's not good because they will disturb our privacy."</s>

en: HIV testing is supposed to be private.
xho: Uvavanyo lwe-HIV kufuneka lube lolwabucala.
mt0: <pad> HIV testing should be confidential.</s>

en: No one is supposed to know that I went for an HIV testing unless I make a choice to tell them," said Jailosi.
xho: Akukho mntu ekumele ukuba azi ukuba ndiye kuvavanyo lwe-HIV ngaphandle kokuba ndenza ukhetho lokumxelela,” utshilo uJailosi.
mt0: <pad> No one should know I'm going to get tested for HIV unless I make the choice to tell," said Jailosi.</s>

en: Ester Makonokaya, a secretary in Blantyre, said that although she has been tested already, she feels the door-to-door HIV testing will violate people's privacy.
xho: U-Ester Makonokaya, unobhala eBlantyre, uthe nangona sele evavanyiwe, uvakalelwa kukuba ukuvavanyelwa intsholongwane kaGawulayo kwindlu ngendlu kuzokophula iimfihlo zabantu.
mt0: <pad> Ester Makonokaya, secretary in Blantyre, said although she has been tested, she feels that the HIV test at every house will violate the privacy of people.</s>

en: Government should instead take the mobile clinics to the villages where people will be able to access them on their own rather than taking testing in their homes, because that might mean that some of the people who are not supposed to know other peoples status will know because, you know, when someone has been tested you show some reactions, said Makonokaya.
xho: “Urhulumente makathathe ezi kliniki zihambayo azise ezilalini apho abantu bazokwazi ukufikelela kuzo bodwa kunokuba baye kuvavanyo emakhayeni abo, kuba loo nto ingathetha ukuba abanye abantu ekungafanelanga ukuba bazazi iimeko zabanye abantu. kuba uyazi ukuba xa umntu evavanyiwe ubonakalisa ukusabela,” utshilo uMakonokaya.
mt0: <pad> "The government should take these mobile clinics and bring them to rural areas where people can get access to them alone instead of going to be tested at their homes, because that could mean that some people might not know the status of others. Because you know that when someone is tested, he or she shows a reaction," said Makonokaya.</s>

en: Macpherson Maulana, a journalist in Blantyre and a producer of radio programs on health, told VOA that government would do better to educate Malawians on the need for HIV testing so that people will go for tests on their own "without being pushed."
xho: UMacpherson Maulana, intatheli yaseBlantyre nokwangumvelisi weenkqubo zikanomathotholo ngezempilo, uxelele iVOA ukuba urhulumente uzokwenza ngcono ukufundisa abantu baseMalawi ngesidingo sokuvavanyelwa intsholongwane kagawulayo ukuze abantu baziyele ngokwabo uvavanyo ngaphandle kokutyhalwa.
mt0: <pad> Macpherson Maulana, a Blantyre journalist and producer of radio health programs, told the VOA that the government will do better to educate Malawians about the need for HIV tests so that people can take their own HIV tests without fear.</s>

en: I fear it could end up into fights.
xho: “Ndiyoyika ukuba ingaphelela ekulweni.
mt0: <pad> "I'm afraid it'll turn into a fight.</s>

en: You see it happened in Liberia recently where people who were coming to help people suspected to have contracted Ebola were even killed.
xho: Uyabona kwenzekile eLiberia mva nje apho abantu ababeze kunceda abantu ekurhaneleka ukuba bosulelwe yi-Ebola bade babulawa.
mt0: <pad> You know what happened in Liberia recently where people who tried to help Ebola-infected people were killed.</s>

en: So, civic education is the most important element for people to be encouraged to come out for testing voluntarily," said Maulana.
xho: Ngoko ke, imfundo yezoluntu yeyona nto ibalulekileyo ukuze abantu bakhuthazwe ukuba baphume baye kuvavanywa ngokuzithandela,” utshilo uMaulana.
mt0: <pad> So, community education is the most important thing to encourage people to go out and get tested voluntarily," said Maulana.</s>

en: However, HIV/AIDS counselor David Odali, whose NGO Umunthu Foundation runs HIV-related projects, insisted privacy will be protected.
xho: Nangona kunjalo, umcebisi weHIV/AIDS, uDavid Odali, nophethe umbutho i-Umunthu Foundation eqhuba iiprojekthi ezinxulumene ne-HIV, ugxininise ukuba iimfihlo ziza kukhuselwa.
mt0: <pad> However, HIV/AIDS advisor David Odale, who is also the head of the Human Foundation which conducts projects related to HIV, insisted that privacy will be protected.</s>

en: Confidentiality will be upheld. Lets consider the household setup.
xho: Imfihlo iya kugcinwa. Makhe siqwalasele ukusekwa kwekhaya.
mt0: <pad> The privacy will be maintained. Let's consider the setting up of a home.</s>

en: I think the first thing would be to provide group counseling to members of that family.
xho: Ndicinga ukuba into yokuqala iya kuba kukubonelela ngengcebiso yeqela kumalungu olo sapho.
mt0: <pad> I think the first thing would be to provide group counseling to the members of that family.</s>

en: [Of course] people can be tested while others are watching, but when it comes to disclosing the results, a counselor is supposed to disclose that results to each and every individual separately," said Odali.
xho: [Ewe] abantu banokuvavanywa ngelixa abanye bejonge, kodwa xa kuthethwa ngeziphumo, umcebisi kufuneka aveze ezo ziphumo kumntu ngamnye ngokwahlukeneyo,” utshilo u-Odali.
mt0: <pad> [Yes] people can be tested while others watch, but when it comes to the results, the counselor should present those results to each individual separately," said Odali.</s>

en: Odali said it will be up to the person who has been tested to disclose his or her status.
xho: UOdali uthe izakuba kuye umntu ovavanyiweyo ukuba aveze ubume bakhe.
mt0: <pad> Odal said it would be difficult for the test-taker to reveal his identity.</s>

en: In 2006, the charity Development Aid from People to People conducted door-to-door HIV testing in the district of Thyolo and Blantyre, reaching 400,000 people.
xho: Ngo-2006, i-charity Development Aid from People to People yenza uvavanyo lwe-HIV kwindlu ngendlu kwisithili saseThyolo naseBlantyre, lwafikelela kuma-400,000 abantu.
mt0: <pad> In 2006, charity Development Aid from People to People conducted HIV testing at home in the districts of Thyolo and Blantyre, reaching 400,000 people.</s>

en: The organization says it worked well.
xho: Lo mbutho uthi usebenze kakuhle.
mt0: <pad> The organization says it has worked well.</s>

en: Water Crisis Raises Fears of Waterborne Disease in Malawi.
xho: Ingxaki yamanzi Iphakamisa uloyiko lwezifo ezibangelwa ngamanzi eMalawi.
mt0: <pad> Water Problem Raises Fears of Diseases Caused by Water in Malawi</s>

en: Malawians in the country's commercial capital, Blantyre, usually rely on tap water.
xho: Abantu baseMalawi abakwikomkhulu lezorhwebo lelizwe, iBlantyre, bakholisa ukuxhomekeka kumanzi aphuma empompeni.
mt0: <pad> The people of Malawi in the commercial capital of the country, Blantyre, often depend on tap water.</s>

en: But for the past five months, the taps have often run dry, forcing residents to draw water from unprotected sources like rivers and wells, while work is being done at the city main pumping station.
xho: Kodwa kwezi nyanga zintlanu zidlulileyo, iitepu bezisoloko zomile, nto leyo enyanzelise abahlali ukuba bakhe amanzi kwimithombo engakhuselekanga efana nemilambo namaqula, logama kusetyenzwa kwisikhululo sokumpompa amanzi edolophini.
mt0: <pad> But in the last five months, the rivers have been drying out, forcing residents to source water from unsafe sources such as rivers and marshes, while work is underway on a city pump station.</s>

en: The risk of contracting water-borne diseases is rising.
xho: Umngcipheko wokufumana izifo ezibangelwa ngamanzi uyakhula.
mt0: <pad> The risk of getting waterborne diseases is growing.</s>

en: In Blantyre and surrounding areas, residents have spent five days without tap water.
xho: EBlantyre neziphaluka, abahlali bachithe iintsuku ezintlanu bengenawo amanzi aphuma etephini.
mt0: <pad> In Blantyre and the surrounding areas, residents have been without water for five days.</s>

en: Women, who by Malawi tradition are responsible for household tasks, complain of the risks they face when fetching water from rivers far from residential areas.
xho: Abasetyhini, abathi ngokwesiko laseMalawi banoxanduva lokwenza imisebenzi yasekhaya, bakhalaza ngeengozi abahlangabezana nazo xa besiya kukha amanzi emilanjeni ekude neendawo zokuhlala.
mt0: <pad> Women, who are traditionally responsible for the domestic work, complain about dangers they face when they go to collect water from a river far from their villages.</s>

en: Rhoda Milanzi, a housewife and mother of three, tells VOA the journeys through bushy footpaths are risky.
xho: URhoda Milanzi, umama wekhaya kunye nomama wabantwana abathathu, uxelele iVOA ukuba uhambo oluhamba kwiindledlana zeenyawo lunobungozi..
mt0: <pad> Rhoda Milanzi, a homemaker and mother of three children, told the VOA that walking on foot trails is dangerous.</s>

en: We wake up every day 2 a.m., sometimes 1 a.m., to go and collect water.
xho: “Sivuka yonke imihla ngentsimbi yesi-2 kusasa, ngamanye amaxesha ngo-1 ekuseni, siye kukha amanzi.
mt0: <pad> We get up every day at 2 o'clock in the morning, sometimes at 1 o'clock in the morning, to go for water.</s>

en: There are so many risks.
xho: Kukho imingcipheko emininzi.
mt0: <pad> There are many dangers.</s>

en: You see, sometimes we would meet witches, snakes on the way," she says, "even hyenas have been chasing us."
xho: Uyabona maxa wambi sasidibana namagqwirha, iinyoka endleleni,” utsho, “neengcuka zazisileqa.
mt0: <pad> You know, we sometimes met with lions, snakes on the trail," he said, "and the wolfs were galloping."</s>

en: Milanzi says to ease the burden of carrying water home for bathing, women prefer to bathe in the river.
xho: UMlanzi uthi ukuthomalalisa umthwalo wokuthwala amanzi okuhlamba ekhaya, abafazi bakhetha ukuhlamba emlanjeni.
mt0: <pad> The ladies choose to wash in the river, Mwangi says.</s>

en: But she says they have been disturbed by youths who hide in the nearby bush.
xho: Kodwa uthi baye baphazanyiswa lulutsha oluzifihle kumatyholo akufutshane.
mt0: <pad> But he said they were interrupted by young people hiding in the nearby trees.</s>

en: These youths of today would come there and hide somewhere to see us naked.
xho: “Olu lutsha lwanamhlanje luza kufika apho luzifihle ndaweni ithile ukuze lusibone sihamba ze.
mt0: <pad> "The young people of today will be hiding somewhere to see us walking.</s>

en: This has been a major embarrassment. In fact we complained to the chiefs about it.
xho: Oku kuye kwaba lihlazo elikhulu. Ngenene sakhalaza kwiinkosi ngalo nto.
mt0: <pad> This was a great disgrace. We actually complained to the kings about it.</s>

en: They punished some of them, but you know they would sometimes climb trees just to look at older women like us taking a bath," she explains.
xho: Abanye babo bohlwaya, kodwa uyazi ukuba ngamanye amaxesha bebekhwela emithini ukuze bajonge abafazi abadala njengathi xa sihlamba,” ucacise watsho.
mt0: <pad> Some of them are shy, but you know that they sometimes rode on horses to look at women like us when we were bathing,” she added.</s>

en: The water problem also has affected the delivery of health services.
xho: Ingxaki yamanzi ikwachaphazele ukuhanjiswa kweenkonzo zempilo.
mt0: <pad> The water problem affected the delivery of health services.</s>

en: Three weeks ago, authorities at Queen Elizabeth Central Hospital in Blantyre confirmed that they had suspended surgical operations due to water scarcity.
xho: Kwiiveki ezintathu ezidlulileyo, abasemagunyeni kwisibhedlele iQueen Elizabeth Central eBlantyre baqinisekise ukuba baye banqumamisa ukwenza utyando ngenxa yokunqaba kwamanzi.
mt0: <pad> Three weeks ago, officials at Queen Elizabeth Central Hospital in Blantyre confirmed that they had suspended delivery services due to water shortage.</s>

en: Health rights campaigners warn of the possible outbreak of waterborne diseases, especially in densely populated areas, if the situation is left unresolved.
xho: Abakhankasi bamalungelo ezempilo balumkisa ngokuqhambuka kwezifo ezibangelwa ngamanzi, ngakumbi kwiindawo ezixineneyo, ukuba le meko ishiywe ingasonjululwanga.
mt0: <pad> Health activists warn of the outbreak of water-related diseases, particularly in crowded areas, if this situation is left unsolved.</s>

en: Officials at the Blantyre Water Board attribute the problem largely to an ongoing European Union-funded project that seeks to install new pumping machines at Walkers Ferry, the main pumping station.
xho: Amagosa eBlantyre Water Board abalela ingxaki ikakhulu kwiprojekthi eqhubekayo exhaswa ngemali yi-European Union efuna ukufakela oomatshini bokumpompa abatsha kwi-Walkers Ferry, isikhululo sokumpompa esikhulu.
mt0: <pad> The Blantyre Water Board officials blamed the problem mainly on a European Union-funded project to install new pumps at Walkers Ferry, the country's biggest pump station.</s>

en: Priscilla Mateyu, the spokesperson for the Blantyre Water Board, says the project is expected to increase water production capacity to 105,000 cubic meters per day from the current daily production of 78,000 cubic meters.
xho: UPriscilla Mateyu, osisithethi sebhodi yamanzi eBlantyre, uthi le projekthi kulindeleke ukuba inyuse umthamo wokuvelisa amanzi ukuya kutsho kwi-105,000 cubic metres ngosuku ukusuka kwimveliso ekhoyo ngoku eyi-78,000 cubic metres ngosuku.
mt0: <pad> Priscilla Mateyu, a spokesperson for the Blantyre Water Board, said the project is expected to increase water production to 105,000 cubic metres per day from the current 78,000 cubic metres per day production.</s>

en: January is when the project is finishing. But for the new machines and everything else to start working properly, we have to wait until March [2015].
xho: NgoJanuwari kuxa iprojekthi iphela. Kodwa ukuze oomatshini abatsha nayo yonke enye into iqale ukusebenza kakuhle, kufuneka silinde kude kube nguMatshi [2015].
mt0: <pad> In January the project was finished. But for the new machines and everything else to start working properly, we had to wait till March [2015].</s>

en: That's when we expect the levels would increase and also production capacity improving to least what we expect it to be," Mateyu said.
xho: Kulapho silindele ukuba amanqanaba anyuke kwaye nomthamo wemveliso uphucuke ubeyilento silindele ukuba ibe yiyo,” utshilo uMateyu.
mt0: <pad> When we expect the standards to rise and the output to improve, that's what we want it to be," said Matthew.</s>

en: The local consumer rights watchdog, the Consumers Association of Malawi, had been planning to hold vigils at the water board until the water supply was normalized, but the board asked protesters to hold off, promising to distribute water to residents through mobile water tanks.
xho: Iqumrhu elijongene namalungelo abathengi basekuhlaleni, iConsumers Association of Malawi, bebeceba ukubamba imilindelo kwibhodi yamanzi de kube yinto eqhelekileyo ukuhanjiswa kwamanzi, kodwa ibhodi yacela abaqhankqalazi ukuba bayeke, bethembisa ukuhambisa amanzi kubahlali ngokusebenzisa iitanki zamanzi ezihambayo.
mt0: <pad> The local consumers association, the Consumers Association of Malawi, planned to hold protests against the water board until water service was restored, but the board asked the protesters to stop, promising to provide water to the residents through mobile water tanks.</s>

en: The consumer rights group has given the water board two weeks to fulfill its commitment before proceeding with the protests.
xho: Iqela lamalungelo abathengi linike ibhodi yamanzi iiveki ezimbini ukuba ifezekise isibophelelo sayo phambi kokuba iqhube noqhanqalazo.
mt0: <pad> The Consumers' Rights Group gave the water board two weeks to fulfill its commitment before it began a protest.</s>

en: Water Crisis Raises Fears of Waterborne Disease in Malawi
xho: Ingxaki Yamanzi Iphakamisa Uloyiko Lwezifo Ezibangelwa Ngamanzi eMalawi
mt0: <pad> The water problem raises the risk of infections from contaminated water in Malawi.</s>

mt0: <pad> The people of Malawi in the commercial capital of the country, Blantyre, often depend on tap water.</s>

xho: Kodwa kwezi nyanga zintlanu zidlulileyo, iitepu bezisoloko zomile, nto leyo enyanzelise abahlali ukuba bakha amanzi kwimithombo engakhuselekanga efana nemilambo namaqula, logama kusetyenzwa kwisikhululo sokumpompa amanzi edolophini.
mt0: <pad> But in the last five months, the lakes have been drying out, forcing residents to draw water from unsafe sources such as rivers and marshes, while work is underway on a city pump station.</s>
