xho: “Ndicinga ukuba yinto efanelekileyo ukuba amapolisa ayenze,” utshilo.
mt0: <pad> "I think it's a good thing for the police to do," he said.</s>

en: However, the challenge with that is that it speaks to a wider problem in Tanzania as far as a closing civic space and the opportunities that people in civic society have to freely express themselves.
xho: “Nangona kunjalo, umceli mngeni apho kukuba ibonisa ngengxaki ebanzi eTanzania xa kujongwe umba wokuvala indawo yasekuhlaleni kunye namathuba okuba abantu basekuhlaleni baveze izimvo zabo ngokukhululekileyo.
mt0: <pad> "However, the challenge there is that it shows a widespread problem in Tanzania when it comes to the issue of closing local sites and the possibility for local people to express their opinions freely."</s>

en: This is part of a wider pattern of civic repression in the country."
xho: Le yinxalenye yendlela ebanzi yocinezelo loluntu kweli lizwe. "
mt0: <pad> This is part of a wider system of human censorship in this country.</s>

en: International groups like the Committee to Protect Journalists have also warned of increased repression.
xho: Amaqela amazwe ngamazwe afana neCommittee to Protect Journalists nawo alumkise ngokwanda kwengcinezelo.
mt0: <pad> International organizations such as the Committee to Protect Journalists have also warned of an increased pressure on journalists.</s>

en: Ahead of the SADC summit, the watchdog group noted its concerns about a "deeply troubling erosion of press freedom," and of "attacks on individual journalists, media suspensions, internet shutdowns, and restrictive legislation."
xho: Phambi kwengqungquthela ye-SADC, iqela labajongi liqaphele iinkxalabo zalo malunga "nokhukuliseko olukhulu lwenkululeko yeendaba," kunye "nohlaselo lweentatheli ezizimeleyo, ukumiswa kweendaba, ukuvalwa kwe-intanethi, kunye nomthetho othintelayo."
mt0: <pad> Before the SADC conference, the watchdog group raised concerns about "a greatly violated press freedom," and "attacks on independent journalists, censure of media, internet censorship, and restrictive law."</s>

en: The CPJ made special mention of Tanzanian journalists Azory Gwanda, who has been missing since 2017, and Erick Kabendera, who was arrested last month and charged with economic crimes, which the organization says is in retaliation for his critical journalism.
xho: I-CPJ ithethe ngokukodwa ngeentatheli zaseTanzania u-Azory Gwanda, owalahleka ukusukela ngo-2017, kunye no-Erick Kabendera, owabanjwa kwinyanga ephelileyo wabekwa ityala lolwaphulo-mthetho lwezoqoqosho, apho mbutho uthi uziphindezela ngobuntatheli bakhe obugxekayo.
mt0: <pad> The CPJ has spoken out specifically about Tanzanian journalists Azory Gwanda, who has been missing since 2017, and Erick Kabendera, who was arrested last month and charged with economic crimes, which the organization says is a revenge for his critical reporting.</s>

en: Kabendera remains behind bars. On Monday, Eden, his lawyer, said the court decided to adjourn to give prosecutors more time to investigate. That will keep him in jail for more than a week longer, until Aug. 30.
xho: UKabendera  usavalelwe. NgoMvulo, u-Eden, igqwetha lakhe, uthe inkundla igqibe kwelokuba inqumamise ukunika abatshutshisi ixesha elongezelelweyo lokuphanda. Loo nto iza kumgcina entolongweni ixesha elingaphezu kweveki, kude kube ngu-Agasti 30.
mt0: <pad> They still have to keep him in jail. On Monday, his lawyer, Eden, said the court decided to give prosecutors more time to investigate. That will keep him in jail for over a week, until August 30.</s>

en: Anna Henga, director of the Legal and Human Rights Center, said police actions only further a worrying trend in Tanzania under President John Magafuli, whom critics say is becoming increasingly authoritarian.
xho: U-Anna Henga, umlawuli weLegal and Human Right Center, uthe izenzo zamapolisa ziqhubela phambili inkxalabo eTanzania phantsi koMongameli uJohn Magafuli, apho abangxeki bathu uya ephatha ngegunya.
mt0: <pad> Anna Henga, director of the Legal and Human Right Center, said police actions increased concerns in Tanzania under President John Magufuli, whom critics say he is taking power with excessive force.</s>

en: This means the continuation of a limited civic space. Because this has happened since 2016.
xho: Oku kuthetha ukuqhubeka kweendawo zokuhlala ezilinganiselweyo. Kuba oku oko kusenzeke ukususela ngo-2016.
mt0: <pad> This means the continuation of limited accommodation. Because this has been the case since 2016.</s>

en: There are a lot of issues, there is a negative development toward limited civic space.
xho: Kukho imiba emininzi, kukho uphuhliso olubi olubhekiselele kwindawo elinganiselweyo yoluntu.
mt0: <pad> There are many problems, there is a bad development that is focused on a small number of people.</s>

en: And it is targeted to people like civil society organizations, the media, hindering the freedom of speech, the freedom of association."
xho: Kwaye ijolise kubantu abafana nemibutho yoluntu, amajelo eendaba, ethintela inkululeko yokuthetha, inkululeko yombutho."
mt0: <pad> It is aimed at people like civil society, media, which restricts the freedom of speech, the freedom of association.</s>

en: Few Demonstrators Turn Up for Zimbabwe Protest in Bulawayo
xho: Bambalwa abaqhankqalazi abazimase uqhankqalazo lwaseZimbabwe eBulawayo
mt0: <pad> Many protesters gathered in Bulawayo to stage a Zimbabwean demonstration.</s>

en: Few people have turned up for an opposition protest in Bulawayo, Zimbabwe's second city, on Monday as armed police maintained heavy presence on the streets and at a courthouse where the opposition is pressing to be allowed to hold the demonstration.
xho: Bambalwa abantu abathe bazimasa  uqhankqalazo eBulawayo, isixeko sesibini saseZimbabwe, ngoMvulo njengoko amapolisa axhobileyo ethe gqolo ukuhlala ezitalatweni nakwinkundla yamatyala apho amaqela aphikisayo anyanzelise ukuba avunyelwe ukuba enze umboniso.
mt0: <pad> Many people turned up for the protest in Bulawayo, the second city of Zimbabwe, on Monday as riot police continued to stand guard in the streets and at the courthouse where the opposition groups tried to force them to be allowed to hold a rally.</s>

en: Business in Bulawayo's usually bustling downtown was subdued with the most traffic from police trucks, water cannons and dozens of police officers patrolling on foot.
xho: Amashishini edolophini yakwaBulawayo ahlala ephithizela yothotywa kukuzala kweelori zamapolisa, iimoto zamanzi kunye nentaphane yamapolisa ejikeleza ngeenyawo.
mt0: <pad> The businesses in Bulawayo are often shuttered by the lack of police lorries, water trucks and foot patrols.</s>

en: The opposition party, the Movement for Democratic Change, had called the protest as part of a planned series of demonstrations to push President Emmerson Mnangagwa to agree to a transitional government amid a rapidly deteriorating economy and rising political tensions.
xho: Umbutho ophikisayo, iMovement for Democratic Change, yabiza uqhankqalazo njengenxalenye yoqhankqalazo olucwangcisiweyo lokunyanzela uMongameli Emmerson Mnangagwa ukuba avume urhulumente wenguqu phakathi koqoqosho oluwohlokayo kunye noxinzelelo lwezopolitiko.
mt0: <pad> The opposition movement, the Movement for Democratic Change, called the protests as part of a planned protest to force President Emmerson Mnangagwa to accept a government of change amid a falling economy and political pressure.</s>

en: But the police banned the protest in the southern city, citing security concerns.
xho: Kodwa amapolisa aluvala uqhanqalazo kwidolophu esemazantsi, echaza inkxalabo yokhuseleko.
mt0: <pad> But police did not stop the protests in the southern city, citing security concerns.</s>

en: A Bulawayo magistrate is hearing the opposition party's challenge to the ban.
xho: Umantyi waseBulawayo umamele umngeni wombutho ophikisayo malunga nokuvalwa koluqhankqalazo.
mt0: <pad> The Bulawayo police officer accepted the challenge of the opposition group about the closure of the protest.</s>

en: The protest was planned as a follow up to demonstrations held in the capital, Harare, on Friday when several hundred demonstrators marched in defiance of a police ban that was upheld by the High Court.
xho: Olu qhankqalazo belucwangciswe njengokulandelela uqhankqalazo obelubanjwe kwikomkhulu, iHarare, ngoLwesihlanu xa abaqhankqalazi abangamakhulu bebengahambisani nomthetho wamapolisa owaphunyezwa yiNkundla ePhakamileyo.
mt0: <pad> The protest was planned to follow a large protest held in the capital, Harare, on Thursday when hundreds of protesters were unhappy with the police law passed by the High Court.</s>

en: Police used tear gas and beatings with batons to quell the Harare protest.
xho: Amapolisa asebenzise izintywizisi kunye nokubetha ngeentonga ukunqanda uqhankqalazo lwaseHarare.
mt0: <pad> Police used tear gas and bats to disperse the Harare protest.</s>

en: Zimbabweans Claim Police Brutality During Economic Protests
xho: Abemi baseZimbabwe babanga inkohlakalo yamapolisa ngexesha yoqhanqalazo lwezoqoqosho
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwean citizens accuse police of brutality during the economic protests.</s>

en: Zimbabweans defied a police ban Friday and held demonstrations to protest the country's deteriorating economy.
xho: Abantu baseZimbabwe baye badelela ukuvalwa koqhanqalazo ngamapolisa ngoLwesihlanu kwaye babambe uqhanqalazo bekhalazela ukudodobala koqoqosho lweli lizwe.
mt0: <pad> Zimbabweans have protested against the police's ban on the protest on Thursday and have staged a protest against the economic downturn of the country.</s>

en: Despite the High Court ban on planned protests, members of the Movement for Democratic Change took to the streets and clashed with police.
xho: Nangona iNkundla ePhakamileyo iye yaluvala uqhanqalazo olucetywayo, amalungu eMovement for Democratic Change angena ezitalatweni angquzulana namapolisa.
mt0: <pad> Although the Supreme Court has banned the planned protest, members of the Movement for Democratic Change went on the streets and confronted the police.</s>

en: Some of the injured accused police of derailing protests, which they said were meant to persuade President Emmerson Mnangagwa's government to breathe life into Zimbabwe's moribund economy.
xho: Abanye abonzakeleyo batyhola amapolisa ngokudodobalisa uqhanqalazo, abathi lwenzelwe ukucenga urhulumente kaMongameli Emmerson Mnangagwa ukuba aphefumlele ubomi kuqoqosho lwaseZimbabwe.
mt0: <pad> Some injured people blamed police for disturbing the protest, which they said was to ask President Emmerson Mnangagwa's government to revive the economy of Zimbabwe.</s>

en: With tears on her cheeks, 32-year-old Tafadzwa Bvuta said her degree had not helped her get anything for her three children.
xho: Ethe gwantyi iinyembezi, uTafadzwa Bvuta oneminyaka engama-32 uthe isidanga sakhe asimncedanga nokuba akwazi ukwenzela abantwana bakhe abathathu izinto.
mt0: <pad> Tearful, Tafadzwa Bvuta, 32, said her degree didn't help her at all to make things for her three children.</s>

en: They beat us up, she said of the police. "What have we done? All these security forces are supposed to protect us all — not just one person.
xho: “Basibethe basibetha,” watsho ngamapolisa. "Senze ntoni? Yonke le mikhosi yezokhuseleko kufanele ukuba isikhusele sonke - hayi umntu omnye.
mt0: <pad> "They beat them," he said of the police. "What have we done? All these security forces should be protecting us all - not just one person."</s>

en: Where will we go and survive?
xho: Siza kuya phi size sisinde?
mt0: <pad> Where are you going to go?</s>

en: Shall we kill our kids since we are struggling to take care of them?"
xho: Ingaba kufuneka sibabulale abantwana bethu ekubeni sisokola ukubagcina?"
mt0: <pad> Do we have to kill our children when we are struggling to keep them?</s>

en: Make Nyashanu, 27, said he would continue protesting because he is miserable about being unemployed.
xho: UMake Nyashanu ona-27, uthe uzakuqhubeka noqhanqalazo kuba ukhathazekile ngokungaphangeli.
mt0: <pad> Make Nyashanu, 27, said he will continue to protest because he is worried about starvation.</s>

en: He said police were indiscriminately beating demonstrators — even elderly ones and people not protesting.
xho: Uthe amapolisa ebebetha ngokungakhethiyo abaqhankqalazi - nabantu abadala kunye nabantu abangaqhankqalaziyo.
mt0: <pad> He said the police were hitting protesters without distinction - even elderly and non-protesting people.</s>

en: Is this democracy? he asked, adding that it was a peaceful demonstration but police were causing chaos.
xho: Ingaba yidemokhrasi le? ubuze watsho esongeza esithi ibiluqhankqalazo olunoxolo kodwa amapolisa ebedala isiphithiphithi.
mt0: <pad> Is this democracy? he asked, adding that it was a peaceful protest but the police were causing chaos.</s>

en: The opposition said it will hold another protest Monday in Zimbabwe's second largest city, Bulawayo, and will go to other cities and places until the government addresses the economy.
xho: Iqela eliphikisayo lithi liza kubamba olunye uqhankqalazo ngoMvulo kwidolophu yesibini ngobukhulu eZimbabwe, iBulawayo, kwaye lizakuya kwezinye izixeko neendawo de urhulumente alungise uqoqosho.
mt0: <pad> The opposition group said it will hold another protest on Monday in the second-largest city of Zimbabwe, Bulawayo, and will continue to march in other cities and areas until the government improves the economic situation.</s>

en: Government response
xho: Impendulo karhulumente
mt0: <pad> The government's response</s>

en: Information Minister Monica Mutsvangwa called the protests counterproductive, saying January's demonstrations against fuel price increases resulted in $20 million to $30 million in losses for businesses from looting and non-productive days.
xho: Umphathiswa wezoLwazi uMonica Mutsvangwa uthe olu qhankqalazo alusebenzi, esithi uqhankqalazo lukaJanuwari oluchasene nokunyuswa kwexabiso lepetroli lubangele ilahleko yezigidi ezingama-20 ukuya kwi-30 yezigidi zeedola kumashishini ngenxa yokuphangwa kunye neentsuku ezingenamveliso.
mt0: <pad> The Information Minister Monica Mutsvangwa said the protest was useless, saying the January protests against the increase in petrol prices caused losses of 20 to 30 million dollars to business because of the disruption and unproductive days.</s>

en: Government calls on all progressive Zimbabweans to desist from being used by negative forces to destabilize their own country, as this will only prolong the hardships which the government is tirelessly trying to address in a more sustainable manner, she said.
xho: “Urhulumente uhlaba ikhwelo kubo bonke abemi baseZimbabwe abanenkqubela ukuba bayeke ukusetyenziswa ziimpembelelo ezimbi ukudodobalisa ilizwe labo, kuba oku kuzakwandisa ubunzima urhulumente azama ukubulungisa ngendlela ezinzileyo,” utshilo.
mt0: <pad> The government urges all progressive citizens of Zimbabwe to stop being used by negative influences to destabilize their country, as this will only aggravate the difficulties the government is trying to solve with a stable method,” he said.</s>

en: I wish to reiterate the call by His Excellency Comrade ED Mnangagwa for all patriotic Zimbabweans to resort to dialogue as a means to solve the challenges we face as a nation.
xho: Ndinqwenela ukuphinda ikhwelo elenziwe ngoHloniphekileyo u-ED Mnangagwa lokuba bonke abemi baseZimbabwe abathand' izwe babhenele kwiingxoxo njengendlela yokusombulula imingeni esijongene nayo njengesizwe.
mt0: <pad> I would like to reiterate the call made by Honourable ED Mnangagwa for all patriotic citizens of Zimbabwe to join in discussions as a way to solve the problems we are facing as a nation.</s>

en: Daniel Molokhele, the spokesman for the opposition, said his party was against Mnangagwa leading talks and accused him of stealing Zimbabwe's last election in 2018.
xho: UDaniel Molokhele, isithethi seqela eliphikisayo, uthe umbutho wakhe uchasene neengxoxo azikhokelayo uMnangagwa kwaye wamtyhola ngobusela kunyulo lokugqibela lwaseZimbabwe ngo-2018.
mt0: <pad> Daniel Molokhele, a spokesman for the opposition party, said his group had participated in the talks led by Mnangagwa and accused him of fraud in the last election of Zimbabwe in 2018.</s>

en: He said the protests would continue until Zimbabwe's economy gets back on track.
xho: Uthe olu qhankqalazo luzakuqhubeka de uqoqosho lwaseZimbabwe lubuyele esimeni.
mt0: <pad> He said the protests will continue until the Zimbabwean economy is back to its normal state.</s>

en: UN Condemns Government Crackdown on Peaceful Protests in Zimbabwe
xho: I-UN Igxeka urhulumente ngokuqhawula uqhankqalazo olunoxolo eZimbabwe.
mt0: <pad> UN condemns government for breaking up peaceful protests in Zimbabwe</s>

en: The U.N. human rights office is condemning a crackdown Friday in Zimbabwe by riot police on peaceful protesters in the capital, Harare.
xho: I-Ofisi yamalungelo oluntu ye-UN igxeka intshukumo yangoLwesihlanu eZimbabwe eyenziwe ngamapolisa  kubantu abaqhankqalaza ngoxolo kwikomkhulu iHarare.
mt0: <pad> UN Human Rights Office condemns the police action on Thursday in Zimbabwe against peaceful protesters in the capital, Harare.</s>

en: The agency is calling for an investigation into excessive use of force by security forces.
xho: Le arhente imemelela ukuba kwenziwe uphando malunga nokusetyenziswa kakhulu kwezigalo ngoonogada.
mt0: <pad> The agency urges an investigation into the excessive use of cigarettes by guards.</s>

en: U.N. Human Rights spokesman Rupert Colville says there are better ways to deal with the populations legitimate grievances on the economic situation in the country than by cracking down on peaceful protestors.
xho: Isithethi samaLungelo oLuntu kwi-UN uRupert Colville uthi kukho iindlela ezingcono zokujongana nezikhalazo ezisemthethweni zabemi malunga nemeko yezoqoqosho kweli lizwe kunokuba kunqandwe abaqhankqalaza ngoxolo.
mt0: <pad> UN Human Rights spokesman Rupert Colville said there are better ways to address legitimate grievances of the people about the economic situation in the country than to suppress peaceful protesters.</s>

en: We are deeply concerned by the socio-economic crisis that continues to unfold in Zimbabwe.
xho: “Sixhalabile kakhulu ngemeko yezoqoqosho nentlalontle eqhubeka eZimbabwe.
mt0: <pad> "We are very concerned about the economic and social situation in Zimbabwe."</s>

en: While acknowledging efforts made by the government, the international community and the U.N. in Zimbabwe to mitigate the effects of the crisis and reform
xho: Ngelixa sivuma iinzame ezenziwe ngurhulumente, uluntu lwamazwe ngamazwe kunye ne-UN eZimbabwe ukunciphisa iziphumo zobunzima kunye nohlaziyo.
mt0: <pad> While we acknowledge the efforts made by the government, international community and UN in Zimbabwe to reduce the effects of the difficulties and reconstruction, we also recognize the efforts made by the government, international community and UN in Zimbabwe to reduce the impacts of the difficulties and reconstruction.</s>

en: process, the dire economic situation is now impacting negatively on the realization of economic and social rights of millions of Zimbabweans," Colville said.
xho: Inkqubo, imeko yezoqoqosho emaxongo ngoku inefuthe elibi ekufezekisweni kwamalungelo ezoqoqosho nezentlalo ezigidi zabantu baseZimbabwe,” utshilo uColville.
mt0: <pad> The system, the current economic situation has a negative impact on the realization of economic and social rights for millions of people in Zimbabwe,” said Colville.</s>

en: Zimbabwes citizens are struggling with hyperinflation, which has sent prices soaring for essential commodities such as fuel, food, transportation and health care.
xho: Abemi baseZimbabwe batsala nzima ngenxa yokonyuka kakhulu kwamaxabiso ngokuhamba kwexesha , ebangele ukuba amaxabiso anyuke kwizinto ezibalulekileyo ezifana namafutha, ukutya, izithuthi kunye nokhathalelo lwezempilo.
mt0: <pad> The citizens of Zimbabwe have been suffering from the sharp rise in prices over time, which has led to a rise in the cost of important things such as oil, food, cars and health care.</s>

en: Compounding the problems is the ongoing impact of cyclone Idai that hit Zimbabwe in March and a severe drought.
xho: Okongeza iingxaki yimpembelelo eqhubekayo yenkanyamba i-Idai ehlasele iZimbabwe ngoMatshi kunye nembalela enkulu.
mt0: <pad> The continued impact of Cyclone Idai which hit Zimbabwe in March and caused a large flood.</s>

en: The United Nations says one third of Zimbabwes population of 16 million people is in need of humanitarian aid.
xho: Umbutho weZizwe eziManyeneyo uthi isinye kwisithathu sabemi baseZimbabwe abantu abazizigidi ezilishumi elinesithandathu badinga uncedo loluntu.
mt0: <pad> The United Nations says one-third of the people of Zimbabwe, 16 million people, need humanitarian aid.</s>

en: The fallout in terms of casualties and possible arrests from Fridays protests is not yet clear.
xho: Ukuwa malunga nokwenzakala kunye nokubanjwa okunokwenzeka kuqhanqalazo lwangoLwezihlanu akukacaci.
mt0: <pad> The numbers of injuries and possible arrests from Friday's protests are not yet clear.</s>

en: But Colville tells VOA his office has received disturbing reports of human rights violations over the past few months.
xho: Kodwa uColville uxelele iVOA ukuba iofisi yakhe ifumene iingxelo eziphazamisayo zokunyhashwa kwamalungelo oluntu kwezi nyanga zimbalwa zidlulileyo.
mt0: <pad> But Colville told the VOA that his office has received alarming reports of human rights violations in the past few months.</s>

en: There are, as I said, reports coming through right now of very recent abductions, beatings and so on of activists or human rights defenders.
xho: “Kukho, njengoko benditshilo, iingxelo ezizayo ngoku zokuxhwilwa kwabantu, ukubethwa njalo njalo kwamatsha ntliziyo okanye abakhuseli bamalungelo abantu.
mt0: <pad> "There are, as I said, reports coming in now of people being kidnapped, the beating of charity workers or human rights defenders.</s>

en: We have not had a chance to verify those and look in detail apart from the two that occurred a few days ago," Colville said.
xho: Asikhange sibenalo ithuba lokuqinisekisa ezo kwaye sijonge ngokweenkcukacha ngaphandle kwezi zimbini zenzekileyo kwiintsuku ezimbalwa ezidlulileyo, utshilo uColville.
mt0: <pad> We didn't have the opportunity to confirm and look into them in detail except for the two that happened a few days ago, Colville said.</s>

en: So, it is clearly a very tense situation.
xho: Ngoko, kucacile ukuba yimeko enzima kakhulu.
mt0: <pad> So, it is clearly a very difficult case.</s>

en: Colville says state authorities have a duty to ensure peoples rights to freedom of expression and to protect the right to peaceful assembly.
xho: UColville uthi abasemagunyeni banoxanduva lokuqinisekisa amalungelo abantu okuthetha ngokukhululekileyo kunye nokukhusela ilungelo lokuhlanganisana ngoxolo.
mt0: <pad> Colville said authorities have the responsibility to ensure the rights of people to speak freely and protect the right to peacefully gather.</s>

en: The U.N. human rights office is urging the government to engage in a national dialogue to ensure that civil society in all its guises can carry out its activities without fear of intimidation or reprisals for its work.
xho: I-Ofisi yamalungelo oluntu ye-UN ibongoza urhulumente ukuba abandakanyeke kwingxoxo yelizwe ukuqinisekisa ukuba uluntu kuwo onke amaqhinga alo lukwazi ukwenza imisebenzi yalo ngaphandle koloyiko lokugrogriswa okanye impindezelo ngomsebenzi walo.
mt0: <pad> UN Human Rights Office urges the government to participate in national discussions to ensure that the community in all its forms can do its work without fear of intimidation or punishment for its work.</s>

en: Despite Oil and Gas Reserves, Africa Feels Pressure of Rising Energy Costs
xho: Ngaphandle  koovimba be-oyile negesi, i-Afrika ifumana uxinzelelo lokunyuka kweendleko zamandla ombane
mt0: <pad> Apart from oil and gas reserves, Africa is under pressure from the rising cost of energy.</s>

en: Africans are feeling the pinch caused by soaring global energy prices, say analysts, even in countries like Nigeria and Angola that are major exporters of crude oil.
xho: Abantu baseAfrika baziva becinezelekile ngenxa yokunyuka kwamaxabiso ombane ehlabathini, batsho abahlalutyi, nakumazwe afana neNigeria neAngola angawona athumela ioli ekrwada kwamanye amazwe.
mt0: <pad> Africans feel squeezed by the rise in energy prices around the world, say analysts, even in countries like Nigeria and Angola which are exporters of crude oil to other countries.</s>

en: While that handful of oil producers is seeing an increase in revenue – especially since the Russian invasion of Ukraine on February 24 – much of the continent lacks refining capability, forcing countries to pay high prices to import gasoline and other petroleum products from Asia and Europe.
xho: Ngelixa elo qela labavelisi be-oyile libona ukunyuka kwengeniso - ingakumbi ukususela ekuhlaseleni kweRussia i-Ukraine ngoFebruwari 24 - ininzi yelizwekazi ayinakho ukucokisa, okunyanzela amazwe ukuba ahlawule amaxabiso aphezulu ukungenisa i-petroli kunye nezinye iimveliso zepetroliyamu ezivela e-Asia naseYurophu.
mt0: <pad> While this group of oil producers see a rise in profits - especially since Russia's attack on Ukraine on February 24 - most of the continent is unable to compete, forcing countries to pay high prices for importing oil and other petrolium products from Asia and Europe.</s>

en: The continent is further affected by increasing costs for natural gas, a key component of nitrogen-based fertilizers used in food production.
xho: Ilizwekazi lichaphazeleka ngakumbi ngokunyuka kweendleko zegesi yendalo, inxalenye ephambili yezichumisi ezisekelwe kwinitrogen ezisetyenziselwa ukuveliswa kokutya.
mt0: <pad> The country is getting more affected by the rising costs of natural gas, a major part of nitrogen-based fertilizers used in food production.</s>

en: With salaries largely stagnant, more than two-thirds of Africans feel pressured by the rising prices, said Franklin Cudjoe, founding president of the Ghana-based Imani Center for Policy and Education.
xho: Njengoko imivuzo ubukhulu becala imile, ngaphezu kwesibini esithathwini sabantu baseAfrika baziva becinezelekile ngenxa yokunyuka kwamaxabiso, utshilo uFranklin Cudjoe, umongameli owaseka i-Imani Centre for Policy and Education yaseGhana.
mt0: <pad> As wages are mostly steady, over two-thirds of Africans feel squeezed by the rise in prices, said Franklin Cudjoe, president of the founding of the Imani Centre for Policy and Education in Ghana.</s>

en: The continent is affected simply because we depend largely on global oil suppliers, since not many African countries have [their own] oil products, Cudjoe told VOA.
xho: “Ilizwekazi liyachaphazeleka nje kuba sixhomekeke kakhulu kubathengisi be-oyile behlabathi, kuba amazwe amaninzi ase-Afrika engenazo iimveliso ze-oyile,” utshilo uCudjoe.
mt0: <pad> "The country is affected because we are so dependent on the world oil exporters, because many African countries do not have oil products," said Cudjoe.</s>

en: Prices spiked on the global oil market after the invasion of Ukraine triggered a wave of international sanctions against
xho: Amaxabiso onyuke kwimarike yeoli yehlabathi emva kohlaselo lwase-Ukraine olubangele ukohlwaywa kwamazwe ngamazwe
mt0: <pad> The price of oil in the world market rose after the attack in Ukraine which led to international sanctions.</s>

en: Russia, one of the worlds leading exporters of crude.
xho: IRussia, yenye yamazwe ahamba phambili ekuthengiseni izinto ezikrwada kumazwe angaphandle.
mt0: <pad> Russia is one of the leading exporters of drugs to foreign countries.</s>

en: The price briefly climbed to over $120 per barrel this month before settling down to $103 per barrel on Friday.
xho: Ixabiso linyuke ngokufutshane laya kuthi ga kwi-120 yeedola umphanda kule nyanga ngaphambi kokuba lihle liye kutsho kwi-103 yeedola umphanda ngoLwesihlanu.
mt0: <pad> The price briefly rose to 120 dollars a barrel this month before falling to 103 dollars a barrel on Thursday.</s>

en: The surge in energy prices is helping to fuel inflation across Africa.
xho: Ukunyuka kwamaxabiso ombane kungunbangela wokunyuka kwezinga lwamaxabiso kwi-Afrika iphela.
mt0: <pad> The rise in the cost of power has caused a rise in the price of food in Africa.</s>

en: In Ghana, for example, overall consumer price inflation was pegged at 15.7% year-on-year in February compared with 13.9% in January, the countrys Statistical Service said last week.
xho: E-Ghana, umzekelo, ukunyuka kwamaxabiso omthengi kuwonke kwakuxhomekeke kwi-15.7% ngonyaka-nonyaka ngoFebruwari xa kuthelekiswa ne-13.9% ngoJanuwari, i-Statistical Service yelizwe yatsho kwiveki ephelileyo.
mt0: <pad> In Ghana, for example, the CPI index rose by 15.7% year-on-year in February compared with 13.9% in January, the country's Statistical Service said last week.</s>

en: In Zimbabwe, prices are climbing sharply – even overnight.
xho: EZimbabwe, amaxabiso enyuka kakhulu – nangobusuku.
mt0: <pad> In Zimbabwe, the prices have gone up very much – even at night.</s>

en: At a TM supermarket in the capital of Harare, a crate of 30 eggs cost the $6.70 on Tuesday and about $7.81 on Wednesday.
xho: Kwivenkile enkulu yeTM kwikomkhulu laseHarare, ikhreyithi yamaqanda angama-30 ixabisa i-6.70 yeedola ngoLwesibini kwaye malunga ne-7.81 yeedola ngoLwesithathu.
mt0: <pad> At the main TM store in Harare, a basket of 30 eggs cost 6.70 US dollars on Tuesday and around 7.81 US dollars on Wednesday.</s>

en: The price of a loaf of bread went from $1.49 to $1.84; for a kilo of beef, the price jumped from $3.35 to $5.22.
xho: Ixabiso lesonka lasuka kwi-1,49 yeedola ukuya kwi-1,84 yeedola; ngekhilogram yenkomo, ixabiso lenyuke ukusuka kwi-3.35 ukuya kwi-5,22 yeedola.
mt0: <pad> The price of bread went up from $1.49 to $1.84; the price of a kilo of pork went up from $3.35 to $5,22 dollars.</s>

en: Gasoline costs climbed, too. In Harare, the per-liter price climbed from $1.41 to $1.69 from Tuesday to Wednesday.
xho: Amaxabiso epetroli anyukile, nawo. E-Harare, ixabiso le-litha linyuke ukusuka kwi-$ 1.41 ukuya kwi-$ 1.69 ukusuka ngoLwesibini ukuya ngoLwesithathu.
mt0: <pad> The petrol prices have also risen. In Harare, the price of a liter has risen from $ 1.41 to $ 1.69 from Tuesday to Wednesday.</s>

en: The surge in food prices was the biggest driver behind consumer inflation in Egypt, it rose by 8.8% in February – the sharpest increase in nearly three years, according to the state statistics agency, CAPMAS.
xho: Ukunyuka kwamaxabiso okutya kwaba ngoyena mqhubi mkhulu wokunyuka kwamaxabiso e-Egypt, anyuke nge-8.8% ngoFebruwari – okona kunyuka kuphezulu phantse kwiminyaka emithathu, ngokutsho kwe-arhente karhulumente yezibalo, iCAPMAS.
mt0: <pad> The increase in food prices was the biggest driver of the Egyptian price hike, up 8.8% in February – the biggest rise in nearly three years, according to the state statistical agency CAPMAS.</s>

en: Cudjoe said it was crucial for governments and regional bodies such as the African Union to build defenses to cushion consumers in times of economic uncertainty.
xho: UCudjoe uthe kubalulekile ukuba oorhulumente kunye namaqumrhu engingqi anje ngeManyano yase-Afrika bakhe ukhuselo lokukhusela abathengi ngamaxesha okungaqiniseki kwezoqoqosho.
mt0: <pad> Cudjoe said it was important for governments and regional organizations such as the African Union to build a protection network to protect consumers during times of economic uncertainty.</s>

en: Even if it means building defenses in terms of the provision of food, said Cudjoe, adding, "I could imagine Nigeria, if it had had its way, it could be selling foodstuff to most countries at reduced rates by now."
xho: Nokuba oko kuthetha ukwakha ukhuseleko malunga nokubonelela ngokutya, utshilo uCudjoe, esongeza, "Ndiyayicingela iNigeria, ukuba yayinendlela yayo, inokuthengisa ukutya kumazwe amaninzi ngexabiso elithotyiweyo ngoku."
mt0: <pad> Even if that means building food security, he said, "I think Nigeria, if it had its way, could sell food to many other countries at the low price now."</s>

en: There must be that urgency of building for themselves defenses, funds that would make us sustain ourselves -- at least to prevent us from being completely annihilated by these uncertainties in the world.
xho: Kunokuba khukho ukungxamiseka kokuzakhela ukhuseleko ngokunokwabo, iimali ebezinokusenza ukuba sizigcine-- noko ukusithintela ekutshatyalalisweni ngokupheleleyo koku kungaqiniseki emhlabeni.
mt0: <pad> There may be an urgent need to build their own security, a budget that could allow us to keep it -- but only to prevent us from being completely destroyed by the uncertainty of the earth.</s>

en: Chibamba Kanyama, an economist in the Zambian capital of Lusaka, said suspending fuel taxes would be "the most ideal thing to do now under the circumstances" to cushion consumers and industries.
xho: UChibamba Kanyama, ingcali yezoqoqosho kwikomkhulu laseZambia eLusaka, uthe ukunqumamisa irhafu yamafutha kuya kuba "yeyona nto ilungileyo ukuyenza ngoku phantsi kwelemeko" ukuxhasa abathengi kunye namashishini.
mt0: <pad> Chibamba Kanyama, an economist at the Zambian capital Lusaka, said that suspending the oil tax would be "the best thing to do now under the circumstances" to support consumers and businesses.</s>

en: African governments must find a way of responding," he said.
xho: “Oorhulumente baseAfrika kufuneka bafumane indlela yokusabela,” utshilo.
mt0: <pad> "African governments must find a way to respond," he said.</s>

en: It is a choice of whether to reduce taxes to lower the prices or to maintain the price levels and use the revenues to subsidize the most vulnerable in society."
xho: Kufuneka kukhetwe phakathi kuncitshiswa irhafu ukuthoba amaxabiso okanye ukugcina amaxabiso aphantsi kunye nokusebenzisa ingeniso ukuxhasa abona bantu basesichengeni kuluntu."
mt0: <pad> It must be chosen between tax cuts to raise prices or keeping prices low and using the income to support the most vulnerable in the community.</s>

en: But Kanyama also suggested that the geopolitical crisis involving Russia and Ukraine – both big grain exporters to Africa – may create opportunities for African producers.
xho: Kodwa uKanyama ukwacebise ukuba ingxaki yezelizwe kunye nezopolitiko ebandakanya iRussia ne-Ukraine - omabini amazwe angabathengisi abakhulu bokutya okuziinkozo e-Afrika - ingadala amathuba kubavelisi baseAfrika.
mt0: <pad> But Kanyama also suggested that the national and political problems involving Russia and Ukraine - both countries are major exporters of staple food to Africa - could create opportunities for African producers.</s>

en: Supply countries like South Africa, with robust and highly mechanized systems, may find a window of exporting [commodities]
xho: “Amazwe abonelela ngeenkonzo afana noMzantsi Afrika, aneenkqubo ezomeleleyo noomatshini abaphezulu, anokufumana ifestile yokuthumela ngaphandle [impahla]
mt0: <pad> "Service-provider countries like South Africa, with strong systems and high-tech equipment, can get a window to export [goods]."</s>

en: like wheat and other products to fill the gaps left by Russia and Ukraine," Kanyama said.
xho: njengengqolowa kunye nezinye iimveliso zokuvala izikhewu ezishiywe yiRussia ne-Ukraine," utshilo uKanyama.
mt0: <pad>, such as pigs and other products to plug the gaps left by Russia and Ukraine," he said.</s>

en: Kanyama also said support by the international community – for instance, in the form of debt relief for some African nations – is welcome.
xho: UKanyama uphinde wathi inkxaso yoluntu lwamazwe ngamazwe - umzekelo, ngendlela yokunciphisa amatyala kwamanye amazwe aseAfrika - yamkelekile.
mt0: <pad> Kanyama also said that international support - for example, in the form of reducing crimes in other African countries - was welcome.</s>

en: He noted that the Group of 20 – which encompasses seven industrialized nations, some countries with strong or fast-growing economies, and the European Union – "is trying to offer some debt relief."
xho: Waphawula ukuba iQela lama-20 - eliquka amazwe asixhenxe aphuhlileyo, amanye amazwe anoqoqosho oluqinileyo okanye olukhula ngokukhawuleza, kunye ne-European Union - "izama ukunika isiqabu kwityala."
mt0: <pad> He noted that the G20 - which includes seven developed countries, other countries with strong economies or rapidly developing economies, and the European Union - "is trying to speed up the process."</s>

en: Some other countries, such as Zambia, [are] undergoing debt restructuring processes and an IMF program, and to me, this is the only way out of the crisis," Kanyama added.
xho: Amanye amazwe, afana neZambia, aphantsi kweenkqubo zokuhlengahlengisa amatyala kunye nenkqubo ye-IMF, kwaye kum, le kuphela kwendlela yokuphuma kule ngxaki, wongeze watsho uKanyama.
mt0: <pad> Other countries, like Zambia, are under the debt restructuring and the IMF system, and for me, this is the only way out of this problem, he added.</s>

en: This story originated in VOA's English-to-Africa service, with contributions from the Zimbabwe service.
xho: Eli bali liqale kwinkonzo ye-VOA yesiNgesi ukuya e-Afrika, ngamagalelo aphuma kwinkonzo yaseZimbabwe.
mt0: <pad> The story started on the English language service of the VOA to Africa, with reports from the Zimbabwean office.</s>

en: WHO Says Africa's COVID Vaccinations Rose by 15% in February
xho: I-WHO ithi ugonyo lwaseAfrika lwe-COVID lwenyuke nge-15% ngoFebruwari
mt0: <pad> The WHO said the African COVID-19 infection rate increased by 15% in February.</s>

en: The World Health Organization says Africas COVID-19 vaccinations rose by 15% between January and February, as several countries embarked on mass inoculation drives to expand coverage and protect populations from the pandemic.
xho: IWolrd Health Organisation ithi ugonyo lwe-COVID-19 eAfrica lunyuke nge-15% phakathi kukaJanuwari noFebruwari, njengoko amazwe aliqela aye aqalisa ukuqhubela phambili ngokugonywa ukuze andise ukhuseleko kunye nokukhusela abantu kwesisifo sikazwelonke.
mt0: <pad> The World Health Organization says the vaccination of COVID-19 in Africa has risen by 15% between January and February, as several countries have begun to move forward with vaccinations to increase protection and protect people from the national disease.</s>

en: Zimbabwes government says it is launching a "national vaccination blitz" targeting those who have not yet been vaccinated in a country where resistance to the shots has been an issue since the program started last year.
xho: Urhulumente waseZimbabwe uthi usungula "inational vaccination blitz" elijolise kwabo bangekagonywa kwilizwe apho abantu banokungawethembi amayeza okugonya ukususela oko yaqalayo inkqubo yogonyo kulo nyaka uphelileyo.
mt0: <pad> The government of Zimbabwe says it is launching a national vaccination blitz aimed at unvaccinated people in the country where people may not trust the vaccine since the start of the immunization programme last year.</s>

en: The drive come amid government concern over rising COVID-19 cases.
xho: Eli phulo liza phakathi kwenkxalabo karhulumente ngokunyuka kwamanani abantu abafunyenwe bene-COVID-19.
mt0: <pad> The announcement comes amid government concerns over the rise in the number of people found to have COVID-19.</s>

en: Dr. Matshidiso Moeti, WHO regional director for Africa, said in a statement that the increase in COVID-19 vaccinations on the continent was driven mainly by campaigns in populous countries, including the Democratic Republic of Congo, Ethiopia, Kenya, and Nigeria.
xho: UGqr. Matshidiso Moeti, ongumlawuli wengingqi ye-Afrika kwo-WHO, uthethe wenjenje kwingxelo, ukwanda kogonyo lwe-COVID-19 kwilizwekazi kuqhutywa ikakhulu ngamaphulo kumazwe anabantu abaninzi, ukuquka iDemocratic Republic of Congo, i-Ethiopia, iKenya kunye neNigeria.
mt0: <pad> Dr. Matshidiso Moeti, the WHO's director of the African Region, said in a report that the increase in COVID-19 cases in the country is primarily due to campaigns in high-population countries, including the Democratic Republic of Congo, Ethiopia, Kenya and Nigeria.</s>

en: Dr. Thierno Balde, the WHO Africa regional COVID-19 incident manager, he says the continent must remain vigilant.
xho: UGqr. Thierno Balde, umphathi we-WHO kwingingqi yaseAfrika kwicandelo le-COVID-19, uthi ilizwekazi kufuneka lihlale liphaphile.
mt0: <pad> Dr. Thierno Balde, WHO's director for the African region of the COVID-19 department, said the country should stay vigilant.</s>

en: We have seen what is happening around, in China, and the risk of also having new imitations, new variants still possible.
xho: Siyibonile into eyenzekayo eChina, kunye nomngcipheko wokuba nohlobo lwesifo olutsha, uhlobo lwalentsholongwane ohlustha lusenokwenzeka.
mt0: <pad> We have seen what's happening in China, and the risk of having a new type of disease, a new type of virus is likely.</s>

en: We really need to continue to safeguard our population by taking the vaccine by not relaxing totally.
xho: Ngokwenene kunyanzelekile siqhubeke nokukhusela abantu bethu ngokuthatha inxaxhwba kugonyo ngokungaphumli ngokupheleleyo.
mt0: <pad> In fact, we have to continue to protect our people by participating in the violence without rest.</s>

en: The situation might change.
xho: Le meko inokutshintsha.
mt0: <pad> This situation may change.</s>

en: So we really need to continue adapting some of these social measures and also to get vaccination," Balde said.
xho: Ke kunyanzelekile ukuba siqhubeke sihlengahlengisa amanye ala manyathelo asekuhlaleni kwaye sifumane ugonyo, utshilo uBalde.
mt0: <pad> So we have to continue to weaken some of those social measures and get the drugs, said Balde.</s>

en: The WHO said to boost African COVID-19 vaccine acceptance, it and other organizations were supporting mass vaccination drives in at least 10 priority countries to reach 100 million people by the end of next month.
xho: I-WHO ithe ukonyusa ukwamkelwa kwesitofu sokugonya i-COVID-19 eAfrica, yona kunye neminye imibutho ixhasa ugonyo lwesininzi kumazwe ali-10 aphambili ukufikelela kubantu abazizigidi ezili-100 ekupheleni kwenyanga ezayo.
mt0: <pad> The WHO said it will boost the acceptance of the COVID-19 vaccine in Africa, it and other organizations are supporting mass vaccinations in 10 leading countries to reach 100 million people by the end of next month.</s>

en: Nqobizitha Mangaliso Ndlovu, Zimbabwes acting information minister, said his country would not be left behind.
xho: UNqobizitha Mangaliso Ndlovu, umphathiswa wezolwazi obambeleyo waseZimbabwe, uthe ilizwe lakhe alizukushiywa ngasemva.
mt0: <pad> The acting minister of information in Zimbabwe, Nobunaga Mangaliso Ndlovu, said his country will not be left behind.</s>

en: Regarding the vaccination program, as of 15 March, 2022, a total of 159,628 third doses have been administered to date.
xho: Ngokuphathelele kwinkqubo yogonyo, ukusukela nge-15 kaMatshi, 2022, xa kubalwa i-159,628 yezigonyo zesithathu sele zikhutshiwe ukuza kuthi ga ngoku.
mt0: <pad> Regarding the flight program, as of March 15, 2022, a total of 159,628 third-class tickets have been sold to date.</s>

en: The national vaccination blitz campaign will kick off on Monday, 21 March, 2022, and [the] government is urging those that have not yet been vaccinated to take advantage of this exercise to do so," Ndlovu said.
xho: Iphulo leNational vaccination blitz liza kuqala ngoMvulo, umhla we21 kaMatshi, ngo-2022, kwaye urhulumente ubongoza abo bangekagonywa ukuba basebenzise eli thuba ukwenza oko,” utshilo uNdlovu.
mt0: <pad> The National vaccination blitz will start on Monday, 21 March 2022, and the government is urging those who haven't been vaccinated to take advantage of this opportunity," Ndlovu said.</s>

en: A number of Zimbabweans have refused vaccination, saying they do not trust the mainly donated Chinese-made Sinopharm and Sinovac vaccines.
xho: Uninzi lwabantu baseZimbabwe abalufuni ugonyo, besithi abaluthembi izitofu zogonyo ekunikelwe ngazo zohlobo lweSinopharm kunye neSinovac eyenziwe eChina.
mt0: <pad> Most Zimbabweans do not want to be vaccinated, saying they do not trust the Chinese-made Sinopharm and Sinovac vaccines.</s>

en: The country has lately recorded a rise in new infections – now cumulatively at 244,012 with 5,418 deaths, according to the Johns Hopkins University, which is tracking the global outbreak.
xho: Ilizwe kutsha nje lirekhode ukonyuka kohlobo olutsha lwesifo - ngoku lunyuke lwafika ku-244,012 kunye nabaswelekiyeyo abayi-5,418, ngokutsho kweYunivesithi yaseJohns Hopkins, elandelela esisifo sihlasele ihlabathi lonke.
mt0: <pad> The country has recently recorded a new spike in the infection - now at 244,012 with 5,418 deaths, according to Johns Hopkins University, which is monitoring the outbreak of the disease that has hit the world.</s>

en: Dr. Cleophas Chimbetete, president of Zimbabwe College of Public Health Physicians, attributes that to the recent lifting of restrictive measures, such as lockdowns.
xho: UGqr. Cleophas Chimbetete, umongameli weZimbabwe College of Public Health Physicians, uthi loo nto ibangelwa kukushenxiswa kwamva nje kwemiqathango ethintelayo, enje ngokulwa kwezinto.
mt0: <pad> Dr. Cleophas Chimbetete, president of the Zimbabwe College of Public Health Physicians, said that is due to the recent easing of restrictions on the spread of the disease, such as the war.</s>

en: He says, however, it is not time to panic, just to enforce WHO protocols, such masking and social distancing.
xho: Uthi, nangona kunjalo, ayiloxesha lokoyika, lixehsa lokunyanzelisa imigaqo ye-WHO, efana nokufihla ubuso kunye nokuncitshiswa kwentlalo.
mt0: <pad> He says, however, it is not time for fear, but time to implement the WHO rules, such as masking and social distancing.</s>

en: After relaxing measures, it is expected that cases will slightly go up.
xho: “Emva kokuba kuncitshiswe lemithetho, kulindeleke ukuba amanani abantu abanesisifu anyuke kancinci.
mt0: <pad> "After these restrictions are reduced, it is expected that the number of people with diabetes will rise slightly.</s>

en: But I also think that it is too early to make any meaningful conclusions, I think it is just an opportunity for us to strengthen our preventative measures and continue highlighting to the rest of the population that COVID is still with us.
xho: Kodwa ndicinga ukuba kusekutsha kakhulu ukuba senze naziphi na izigqibo ezinentsingiselo, ndicinga ukuba lithuba nje lethu lokuba someleze amanyathelo ethu okuthintela kwaye siqhubeke nokungxininisa kuluntu ukuba i-COVID iseyinto ekhoyo.
mt0: <pad> But I think it's too early to make any meaningful decisions, I think it's just our chance to strengthen our measures of prevention and continue to stress to the public that COVID isn't a real thing.</s>

en: The good news, though, is that severe cases have not gone up.
xho: Noko ke, iindaba ezimnandi zezokuba imeko zabagula ngamandla azikho phezulu.
mt0: <pad> However, the good news is that the number of severe illnesses is not up.</s>

en: What we need to do is to continue to get vaccinated and what is important is that the government should – as it is doing – is monitor these numbers.
xho: Into ekunyazeleke ukuba siyenzile kukuqhubeka nokugonywa kwaye okubalulekileyo kukuba urhulumente enze – njengoko esenza – abeke iliso kula manani.
mt0: <pad> What we have been forced to do is continue to vaccinate and more importantly that the government do – as it is doing – monitor these numbers.</s>

en: There is no cause for alarm or cause for us to introduce new measures," Chimbetete said.
xho: Akukho sizathu soloyiko okanye isizathu sokuba senze amanyathelo amatsha, ”utshilo uChimbetete.
mt0: <pad> No reason to be afraid or to take any new steps, " said Chimbetete.</s>

en: Zimbabwe had a target of vaccinating at least 10 million people by the end of last year, a figure that some say was difficult to reach given the scarcity of resources and hesitance.
xho: Ilizwe laseZimbabwe belijolise ekugonyeni abantu abazizigidi ezilishumi ubuncinci ekupheleni konyaka ophelileyo, inani abathi bekunzima ukufikelela kulo ngenxa yokunqongophala kwezixhobo kunye nokuthandabuza koluntu.
mt0: <pad> Zimbabwe had aimed to vaccinate at least 10 million people by the end of last year, a target they said was difficult to achieve because of shortage of equipment and public distrust.</s>

en: It has yet to announce when it plans to achieve herd immunity.
xho: Kusafuneka ibhengeze ukuba iceba ukufezekisa ukugonyeka kwabantu abaninzi.
mt0: <pad> It still needs to declare that it intends to achieve the disillusionment of many people.</s>

en: Finland Crowned World's Happiest Nation for Fifth Year
xho: IFinland ithweswe isithsaba sokuba lelona lizwe lonwabileyo kwiminyaka emihlanu elandelelanayo.
mt0: <pad> Finland has been crowned the most happiness country for five consecutive years.</s>

en: Finland has been named the world's happiest country for the fifth year running, in an annual U.N.-sponsored index that again ranked Afghanistan as the unhappiest, followed closely by Lebanon.
xho: IFinland ibizwe njengelona lizwe lonwabileyo kwihlabathi kunyaka wesihlanu uqhuba, kwisalathiso sonyaka esixhaswe yi-UN ephinde yabeka i-Afghanistan njengelona lizwe lingonwabanga, ilandelwa ngokusondeleyo yiLebhanon.
mt0: <pad> Finland has been named the world's most happiness country for the fifth year running, in a UN-backed annual report that also placed Afghanistan as the world's poorest country, followed by Lebanon.</s>

en: Serbia, Bulgaria and Romania recorded the biggest boosts in wellbeing.
xho: ISerbia, iBulgaria kunye neRomania zirekhode ezona zinyuso zinkulu kwimpilontle.
mt0: <pad> Serbia, Bulgaria and Romania have recorded the biggest increases in health.</s>

en: The largest falls in the World Happiness table, released on Friday, came in Lebanon, Venezuela and Afghanistan.
xho: Ukuwa okukhulu kwi World Hapiness Table, ekhutshwe ngoLwesihlanu, yeza eLebhanon, eVenezuela nase-Afghanistan.
mt0: <pad> The biggest falls on the World Happiness Table, released on Thursday, came in Lebanon, Venezuela and Afghanistan.</s>

en: Lebanon, which is facing economic meltdown, fell to second from last on the index of 146 nations, just below Zimbabwe.
xho: ILebhanon, ejongene nokudodobala kwezoqoqosho, yawela kwindawo yesibini ukusuka ekugqibeleni kwisalathiso samazwe ali-146, ngezantsi nje kweZimbabwe.
mt0: <pad> Lebanon, which is facing a economic recession, fell to the second place from the end of the 146 countries in the Index, just below Zimbabwe.</s>

en: War-traumatized Afghanistan, already bottom of the table, has seen its humanitarian crisis deepen since the Taliban took power again last August.
xho: I-Afghanistan ehlaselwe yimfazwe, esele isezantsi etafileni, ibone ingxaki yobuntu isiba nzulu ukusukela oko iTaliban yathatha isihlalo sokuphatha kwakhona ngo-Agasti ophelileyo.
mt0: <pad> The war-ravaged Afghanistan, already the bottom of the table, has seen its human rights problem worsen since the Taliban retook power in August last year.</s>

en: U.N. agency UNICEF estimates one million children under five could die of hunger this winter if not aided.
xho: I-arhente yeZizwe eziManyeneyo iUNICEF iqikelela ukuba abantwana abasisigidi abangaphantsi kweminyaka emihlanu banokubulawa yindlala kobu busika ukuba abancediswa.
mt0: <pad> The United Nations Children's Fund (UNICEF) estimates that one million children under five years old will die of starvation this winter unless they are helped.</s>

en: This (index) presents a stark reminder of the material and immaterial damage that war does to its many victims," co-author Jan-Emmanuel De Neve said.
xho: Esi (isalathiso) sibonisa isikhumbuzo esicacileyo sezinto ezibonakalayo kunye nomonakalo ongabonakaliyo owenziwa yimfazwe kumaxhoba ayo amaninzi, utsho umbhali uJan-Emmanuel De Neve.
mt0: <pad> This (exhibition) shows a clear reminder of the visible and invisible damage done by the war to its many victims, says author Jan-Emmanuel De Neve.</s>

en: The World Happiness Report, now in its 10th year, is based on people's own assessment of their happiness, as well as economic and social data.
xho: IWorld Hapiness Report, ngoku kunyaka wayo we-10, isekelwe kuvavanyo lwabantu lolonwabo lwabo, kunye neenkcukacha zezoqoqosho nezentlalo.
mt0: <pad> The World Happiness Report, now in its 10th year, is based on people's happiness surveys, as well as economic and social data.</s>

en: It assigns a happiness score on a scale of zero to 10, based on an average of data over a three-year period.
xho: Inika amanqaku olonwabo kwisikali ukusuka kwiqanda ukuya kwi-10, ngokusekwe kumndilili wedatha kwisithuba seminyaka emithathu.
mt0: <pad> It gives happiness scores on a scale from zero to 10 based on the mean of data over three years.</s>

en: This latest edition was completed before the Russian invasion of Ukraine.
xho: Olu shicilelo lwamva lwenziwa phambi kokuba iRussia ihlasele iUkraine.
mt0: <pad> The latest release was released before Russia invaded Ukraine.</s>

en: Northern Europeans once again dominated the top spots -- with the Danes second behind the Finns, followed by the Icelandic, the Swiss and the Dutch.
xho: Abantu baseMntla baseYurophu baphinde balawula iindawo eziphezulu - iDanes yikwindawo yesibini emva kweFinns, ilandelwa yi-Icelandic, iSwiss kunye neDutch.
mt0: <pad> Northern Europeans also dominate the top positions - the Danes are second after the Finns, followed by the Icelandic, Swiss and Dutch.</s>

en: The United States rose three places to 16th, one ahead of Britain, while France climbed to 20th, its highest ranking yet.
xho: I-United States inyuke iindawo ezintathu ukuya kwi-16, enye ngaphambi kweBritain, ngelixa iFrance inyuke yaya kwindawo yama-20, indawo yayo ephezulu okwangoku.
mt0: <pad> The United States went up three places to 16th, one above Britain, while France went up to 20th, its current high.</s>

en: As well as a personal sense of wellbeing, based on Gallup polls in each country, the happiness score takes account of GDP, social support, personal freedom and levels of corruption.
xho: Kunye nokuba sempilweni entle, esekwe kuvoto lweGallup kwilizwe ngalinye, amanqaku olonwabo athathela ingqalelo iGDP, inkxaso yezentlalo, inkululeko yomntu kunye nenqanaba lorhwaphilizo.
mt0: <pad> And even though in good health, based on Gallup polls for each country, the happiness scores take into account GDP, social support, human freedom and the level of corruption.</s>

en: This year the authors also used data from social media to compare people's emotions before and after the Covid-19 pandemic.
xho: Kulo nyaka ababhali basebenzise ulwazi oluvela kwimithombo yeendaba zentlalo ukuthelekisa iimvakalelo zabantu ngaphambi nasemva kwesifo sikazwelonke i-Covid-19.
mt0: <pad> This year the authors used social media data to compare people's feelings before and after the national epidemic Covid-19.</s>

en: They found "strong increases in anxiety and sadness" in 18 countries but a fall in feelings of anger.
xho: Bafumene "ukwanda okunamandla kwixhala kunye nokungonwabii" kumazwe ali-18 kodwa ukwehla kweemvakalelo zomsindo.
mt0: <pad> They found "a strong increase in stress and discontent" in 18 countries but a decrease in anger levels.</s>

en: The lesson of the World Happiness Report over the years is that social support, generosity to one another and honesty in government are crucial for wellbeing," report co-author Jeffrey Sachs wrote.
xho: Imfundiso yengxelo yeWorld Hapiness Report  kwiminyaka edlulileyo kukuba inkxaso yentlalontle, isisa komnye nomnye kunye nokunyaniseka kukarhulumente kubalulekile kwintlalo-ntle, utshilo umbhali uJeffrey Sachs.
mt0: <pad> The lesson of the World Happiness Report in the past years is that social support, compassion for one another and government honesty are crucial to a prosperous society, said author Jeffrey Sachs.</s>

en: World leaders should take heed."
xho: Iinkokheli zehlabathi kufuneka zithathele ingqalelo.
mt0: <pad> World leaders must take into account.</s>

en: The report raised some eyebrows when it first placed Finland at the top of its listings in 2018.
xho: Ingxelo yaba nokuthandabuzeka emva kokuba ibeke iFinland phezulu kuluhlu lwayo ngo-2018.
mt0: <pad> The report was controversial after putting Finland at the top of its list in 2018.</s>

en: Many of the Nordic country's 5.5 million people describe themselves as taciturn and prone to melancholy, and admit to eyeing public displays of joyfulness with suspicion.
xho: Uninzi lwabantu belizwe laseNordic lizizigidi ezi-5.5 zabantu bazichaza njengabantu abapholileyo kwaye bathanda ukuba nosizi, kwaye bavume ukuba bajonga imiboniso yoluntu yolonwabo ngeliso lokukrokra.
mt0: <pad> Most of the people of the Nordic country of 5.5 million people describe themselves as cold and sad, and admit to looking at human happiness with suspicion.</s>

en: But the country of vast forests and lakes is also known for its well-functioning public services, ubiquitous saunas, widespread trust in authority and low levels of crime and inequality.
xho: Kodwa ilizwe elinamahlathi namachibi amakhulu likwadume ngeenkonzo zalo zoluntu ezisebenza kakuhle, iisaunas ezifumaneka kuyo yonke indawo, ukuthembela ngokubanzi kwabasemagunyeni namanqanaba aphantsi olwaphulo-mthetho nokungalingani.
mt0: <pad> But the country of large forests and lakes is known for its well-functioning public services, toilets available everywhere, general trust in the authorities and low crime and inequality.</s>
